info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 5:53PM MDT until July 30 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Union County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 900 PM MDT. * At 553 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3.15 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clayton. Clayton Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 and 87 between Mile Markers 418 and 428. Route 370 will be impacted from Clayton Lake State Park to Clayton. East Rita Blanca Creek will flood. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
